body:
using spack to build lua, the lua executable doesn't run when built with clang, or intel compilers.

The issue is with ncurses, which is being lined with -L and -l. I know spack does rpath magic in the compiler wrappers, but the rpath magic doesn't appear to work for the lua build. 

Here is some more info:

Looking at the build line for lua:

```
         'MYLDFLAGS=-L%s -L%s ' % (
             spec['readline'].prefix.lib,
             spec['ncurses'].prefix.lib),
         'MYLIBS=-lncurses',
```

and an older one  (this is the one we actually built with)

```
    make('INSTALL_TOP=%s' % prefix,
         'MYLDFLAGS=-L%s -lncurses' % spec['ncurses'].prefix.lib,
         target)
```

Here is an example of the error we get when trying to run lua built with intel:

../spack/opt/spack/chaos_5_x86_64_ib/intel-15.0.187/lua-5.1.5-rfr5m5nbtre7gkouhvst6waau6mi5qvl/bin/lua
../spack/opt/spack/chaos_5_x86_64_ib/intel-15.0.187/lua-5.1.5-rfr5m5nbtre7gkouhvst6waau6mi5qvl/bin/lua: error while loading shared libraries: libncurses.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

title: lua build isn't using rpath to link ncurses on clang or intel compilers
